title: Beautiful but dangerous
caption: Beware the frozen beauty of Abraham Lake
desc: While Abraham Lake, in Alberta, Canada, is man made, it benefits from the same glacial blue colour of other lakes in the Rocky Mountains. And with colourful skies like this one, this landscape is a photographer’s dream. But what’s that bubbling up beneath the surface? It’s methane, bubbles of which are released when bacteria feeds on organic matter at the bottom of the lake, then get trapped when the water freezes.
copyright: Bubbles in the ice of Abraham Lake in Alberta, Canada (© robertharding/Alamy)
